text: Welcome to How To Cook That I am Ann Reardon

Today I am doing a choc-chip cookie bake off
with yoyomax.

I am going to share with you my secret recipe
for chewy chocolate chunk pretzel cookies.

And you will not be able to eat just one they
are so yummy.

And today I am also doing a bake-off with
Tammy form yoyomax12 so she is making chic

chip cookies for you and she is making rainbow
choc ship cookies.

If you haven't seen Tammy's channel before
make sure you go and check it out she has

heaps of sweet things and if you are watching
How To Cook That then I know you have a sweet
tooth.

So go check that out she has lots of wonderful
creations there as well.

And I'll link to her video at the end of this
one.

So to make these chewy chock chunk pretzel
cookies firstly you are going to need to preheat

your oven to 150C or 300F then chop the chocolate
into chunks.

The better quality chocolate you use the better
your cookies will taste.

Then measure out you butter, baking powder,
flour, glucose syrup or you can use corn syrup,

coconut, brown sugar, white sugar, mini pretzels
and of course the chocolate.

All of the recipe quantities that you need
are on the website howtocookthat.net there

is a link in the description just below this
video directly through to the recipe.

Add the glucose syrup or corn syrup to the
butter melt that in the microwave.

Once it is melted sift in the flour and baking
powder

Then add your coconut,
your brown sugar
and then the white sugar.

Then use a spatula stir all the ingredients
together until they are well combined and
you have a thick smooth cookie mixture.

Which has no eggs in it so if you want to
taste it go ahead and take a spoon.

Now pour in two thirds of your chocolate into
the mixture and all of the pretzels and stir
them through the mixture.

It's quite thick so just give it a bit of
a stir around until it is evenly dispersed.

Then take generous tablespoons of the mixture,
gently squeeze it into a ball and place it
onto a lined baking tray.

Make sure you leave plenty of room between
them for them to spread out when they are
baking.

Once you have filled your tray squash each
one down using the palm of your hand.

Then add your remaining chunks of chocolate
onto the top of each cookie.
Bake them in the slow oven for 15minutes only.

If you want them crunchy you can bake them
for longer, but I like them to be chewy.

When you first pull them out of the oven they
will still seem really soft like this but

as they cool they will crisp up on the edges
and be chewy and delicious in the centre.

Thanks for liking and sharing, leave all your
requests in the comments below and subscribe

to How To Cook That for more cakes, chocolates
and desserts.

Make sure you check out the rainbow choc chip
cookie recipe by yoyomax and let her know
that How To Cook That sent you.

And if you make these cookies take a photo
of them and you can upload them in the comments

section on the website howtocookthat.net
And I'll see you all on Friday, have a great
week.

[music: The Boat Song by youtube.com/setsailtv
used with permission]
